A diastema is a gap between two adjacent teeth, most commonly applied to an open space between the upper incisors (front teeth) in humans. It can happen when there is an unequal relationship between the size of the teeth and the jaw. The condition is also referred to as "gap tooth" and can be caused by the presence of a large labial frenum from the upper lip extending near the teeth. Treatment options include periodontal surgery to reduce the frenum, as well as filling, veneer, crown, or orthodontics depending on the cause and extent of the gap.
